articles.title: What is Computer Science?
articles.body: Computer science is the study of computational systems and the design of computer systems and their applications. It encompasses both theoretical and practical aspects of computing, including algorithms, data structures, programming languages, software engineering, computer architecture, and artificial intelligence.

articles.title: History of Computing
articles.body: The history of computing spans thousands of years, from ancient calculating devices like the abacus to modern digital computers. Key milestones include Charles Babbage's Analytical Engine, Alan Turing's theoretical work, and the development of the first electronic computers in the 1940s.

articles.title: Introduction to Programming
articles.body: Programming is the process of creating instructions for computers to execute. It involves breaking down complex problems into smaller, manageable tasks and expressing the solution in a programming language that the computer can understand.

articles.title: What is an Algorithm?
articles.body: An algorithm is a step-by-step procedure for solving a problem or completing a task. Good algorithms are efficient, correct, and clearly defined. They form the foundation of all computer programs.

articles.title: Introduction to Logic
articles.body: Logic is the foundation of mathematical reasoning and computer science. Propositional logic deals with statements that are either true or false, and the logical operations that can be performed on them.

articles.title: How to Register for Courses
articles.body: Course registration is conducted online through the student portal. Students must meet prerequisites and have advisor approval for certain courses. Registration periods are announced each semester.

articles.title: Joining Student Clubs
articles.body: The university offers over 100 student organizations covering academic, cultural, recreational, and service interests. Students can join existing clubs or start new ones with proper approval.
